dynamic_line: I'm actually a chemistry professor at Harvard.  I'd been on sabbatical for the last six months.  I can't imagine the university was a good place to be, given what I've heard about Bostonâ€¦  I'm not sure anyone made it out.  I was out at my cabin near Chatham, ostensibly working on the finishing touches for a paper, but mostly just sipping whisky and thanking my lucky stars for tenure.  Those were good days.  Then came <the_cataclysm>, the military convoys, the <zombies>.  My cabin was crushed by a <monster>, just collateral damage after it got blasted off Orleans by a tank. responses.text: Do you think there's some way your knowledge could help us understand all this?

dynamic_line: Hard to say.  I'm not really an organic chemist, I did geological chemistry.  I'm at a loss to how that relates, but if you come across something where my knowledge would help I'll gladly offer it.
